reviews.sentence: Excellent grown up accommodation. had not been to HK for a few years and we found it expensive on this visit A has plummeted. But I shopped around and got a good rate for the Ovolo Central so did not book direct with the hotel which I usually do. Highlights. Really good service all the staff we encountered were positive friendly and helpfulGreat location a 10 minute stroll down to the action in Queens Rd etc and the walk up was not too steep did not need the escalator although it is close if you want to use it lots of public transport buses to the door and taxis around cafe and diner either side and a row of restaurants and bars on the next block post office 1 minute walk for the old fashioned etc etcFab room big by HK standards with lovely bathroom great walk in shower and big firm bed with good linenRom giveaways if you like the slippers take them free mini bar nice toiletries …. no doubt factored into the rate and good marketing. but gestures like this make guests feel like grown ups and engender a good felingGod breakfast catered in the O cafe next door. generous menu and pleasant environmentI can not think of any elements I would criticise in the hotel but noise sometimes drifted up from the nearby nightclubs and there is a massive construction site over the road although it did not seem particularly noisy. So while neither posed a major problem for us it is good to be forewarned. And of course construction and nightclub noise are not unusual no matter where you stay in HKSo this was a relaxing and memorable stay and added to our overall enjoyment of HK the last stop of our trip.

Chic and Trendy Ideal Location. it is easy to miss this amazing hotel but I urge you to find the time and energy to seek it out. The rooms are very nicely done the amenities and other perks that are offered make this hotel stand out amongst its peers. It is not a huge brand name but the service and comfort you will find are not going to fail you. The location is perfect for those who want to go out and enjoy HK night life in LKF. We are definitely coming back here now.

Superbe. I was here for 3 nights for business reasons. I arrived late in the evening and the 24h receptions was really helpful. The nice design of the room can offer a great welcome to all the needs together with super availability of hi tech services and a great free minibar. The breakfast in the morning is served in the cafe next door. everything good. Very clean very central very kind service. If I will come back I for sure return in Ovolo. Thanks.

Great location as long as you can walk up big hills and stairs. The staff were friendly the room was reasonably spacious for Hong Kong and the hotel well located. The washing machine worked a treat. The breakfast was average disorganized not available before 730AM the options limited the serves very small and staff either well meaning and stressed or just plain grumpy. The gym was also very very very small it would be better to have an arrangement with a local commercial gym for guests to use their facilities.

Great hotel. What I liked most about this hotel in addition to the location was that the room had everything a traveler could possible need from toiletries slippers free snacks mini bar juices even a bag which I used when I went on a day hike. The staff were responsive and helpful. I loved and would definitely come back and stay here. I liked the breakfast in the diner next door had some healthy option for vegetarians like myself. Overall a great experience.

This was an unexpected surprise. The hotel was in a great location and provided lots of amenities. It was refreshing to have a hotel provide the extras in the cost of the room so no extra costs. Love it. The staff was really helpful. Look forward to my next visit.

Nice rooms good location. it is a boutique hotel in Central. It only has two rooms per floor it is a thin but high building. Room was perfect cool decoration no noise very comfortable and with all kind of amenities. There are couple of free washing machines and small gym by the reception. It has no restaurant but there are a lot of choices around. Only thing i do not like is that you need to climb a bit to get to the hotel.

Great hotel very very recomended. This hotel was just greatThe room very cozy full of amenities to mention afew free mini bar filled up evey day. ketel nescafe machine ironing board iron treat bag office space with printer hair dryer out converter to plug in apliences heating lamp in the bathroom. They really thought of everything. Very big shower super comfortable. The staff was very helpful in finding things around town especially Kiki and Jonathan. The hotel is right next to LKF area which is very fun. This hotel is a sure thing hope they will keep it up.

Great location and room fantastic modern ambience. Great modern room good design and facilities. Free mini bar and snacks were such a good surprise. Really upbeat staff and atmosphere. Err not much. Pillows were a bit soft but I am struggling to find fault.

I absolutely loved this place. Like most of the places in Hong Kong it has a footprint of approximately 10 cm squared and most of its space comes from being very very tall. I was on the 20th floor and had a lovely room with great bed goody bag with snack and sweets Nespreso Alexa and the best hotel bathroom I have ever had. In the reception there is a complimentary snack bar and selection of chilled drinks. Breakfast is served in the diner downstairs and was very good. They even have their own Spotify 80s playlist which is BRILLIANT. it is in a great central location on Arbuthnot Road a few minutes walk to Queens Road for work and a couple of minutes to Wyndham and DAguilar Streets for drinks. Staying here was lots of fun informal but smart and great service. Well worth a look.

I have already written to the managerThere is n’t a bar. Room was clean but entrance due to Reno it was a mess Breakfast at the Diner inadequate staff service were not acceptable. The rate would be fine if it had a lobby reception desk.

Disappointing. The location. Very dusty room lighting equipment disabled horrible noise. almost killed myself when a piece of furniture see picture attached came from the top of the cupboard felt just in front of my head. We were offered a ridiculous discount coupon at check out for our experience I left it on the front desk indeed. The manager was supposed not to be in the building until we complained again and she finally showed up in fact it was the person seating just near by the front desk at check out. Not professional. Avoid it.

Top Notch. Newly renovated gem in the heart of Wyndham St Beautiful art lines the reception area and rooms. Friendly staff await you at the moment you enter the doors all the way till I checked out. Free mini bar in rooms. Wonderful views from my room. Alexis in the room. Amenities that you ’d expect from at a quality hotel. Minutes to the mtr Taxis at the doorstep. Recommended if you want to be in the heart of the entertainment and business districts. Will be back again.

Ideally situated. If you want to be in the middle of town Ovolo ticks the boxes. Walk up the hill and visit the free zoo and botanical gardens sit am ong the flowers and watch the fountain. Discover some back street eateries. Walk down the hill or across the back of the old prison wall and hit central for shopping a variety of restaurants and bars a bit too ex pat and sports bar like for my liking personally. The rooms give a great view of course of this city of towers and hi rises I was on 20th. there is shutters on the window if you need blackout compact bathroom and nice shower wit a seat too free minibar and printer evern i could not quite work that out as it had no paper in it. Great staff at reception who were welcoming and stored our cases. Breakfast was a limited selection in the diner downstairs but I guess covered all I needed rather than wanted nice bit of discipline. Marginally annoying was the spotify disco Ovolo playlist coming out of the elevator 247. If you are visiting for business or first time in HK I would say book here.

Had what I wanted just not as convenient for business. For the business traveller needing to do more work out of the hotel room this hotel did n’t suit as well. It ’s a boutique hotel and getting here is easy up till you get to the exit point of the mid level escalators. Not recommended with luggage and heels. I was coming from IFC and decided to walk with luggage but there was a stretch where the escalator was out of action so I needed to carry my luggage up hill. You then need to negotiate the Tai Kwung police grounds to get here. I liked the free mini bar along with the comfy bathroom. It just did n’t feel as nice to work from at the end of the day. There ’s a safe travel charger. But the phone did n’t seem to work properly and the lighting around the desk not strong enough. For pricing point it ’s worth it for singles or couple looking to spend time outside but less so recommended for families or business travellers. My room rate said it included breakfast at booking but the hotel advised that no breakfast was included. Between Expedia and the hotel they need to sort this out. It ’s close to LKF but yes sadly nightlife on the drinking scene can not be the main draw card for this hotel although there is side passage access direct to LKF in less than 5 mins.

I had my booking through Bokingcom and your hotel was advertised as a 5 stars. If you arrive with the expectation of a 5 stars you want to find swimming pool gym someone to carry the luggages. When you find out they are not available your first impression goes from an expectation of excellent to only good.

Really friendly staff at the Ovolo without being overbearing. The rooms are a good size and have some great features like printers for printing pesky visa forms you may have forgotten about. Nice addition with the free mini bar too. if only I had time to get through it all. The only downside is there is no pool on site which is a really nice amenity to have in the humid Hong Kong weather. Very comfortable beds and a great location. Close enough to LKF without being in the thick of it.
Exceptional. Will return for the next trip. Need access to facilities like pool.

Quaint stylish hotel. Lack of gym is an issue for me for a longer stay business trip but is offset by the location and ‘ quirkiness ’. Addition of a restaurant is a plus since my last visit although I am not vegetarian so more likely to use it only for breakfast.

The Loot bags not being persistent provided. Although this brilliant idea to give as freebies. The courtesy esp from front desk is important only some front desk staff esp like Max and Kiki are truly helpful. I had guest waited for me lobby almost an hour nobody even come over approach her for a glass of water at least. There are room to improve overall I am quite satisfy my stays there. Front desk staff is important to provide guidance esp on location. Step out from counter by providing proper route not pouting on maps which not in full details I was being mislead when I wanted to visit to pure fitness. So near yet so far being guided. Took me 30 minutes to locate the place. What a shame. Hopefully able to Improve the noise came from LKF via Washroom the soundproof is not good enough.

Top service in a funky boutique hotel. I stayed here for a long weekend with girlfriends and we were all very impressed with the service at Ovolo Central. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and fairly quick to resolve problems. The hotel itself is relatively new and very comfortable with everything you might need including little touches such as personalised chocolates power socket converter complimentary happy hour drinks free minibar and quality bathroom products. there is no in house fitness centre or pool but you get access to a fabulous gym a 2min walk away. you are also right in party central with bars and restaurants within stumbling distance but it is quiet in the rooms bring ear plugs just in case you can still hear the bass from nearby DJs on the weekend. Also close by is shopping the botanic garden and zoo and the Peak Tram. My room 702 was huge with plenty of space to stretch your legs and open a suitcase and it featured a corner desk ironing board wardrobe credenza and roomy shower. One of my favourite things. The 80s playlist going all day every day in the lobby. You feel instantly good just being there. And the rock n roll inspired decor is cool. The only downside to this place is that we were all staying on different floors there are 2 rooms per floor. so we could not pop by each others rooms. although this probably keeps things quieter for other guests. I would stay here again.
